pay_input_ranges.title: Hiring Salary Range
pay_input_ranges.blurb:
Our range reflects the hiring range for this position.  We use national average to determine pay as we are a remote first company.  Individual pay is based on a number of factors including qualifications, skills, experience, education, and training.


Base pay is just a part of our total rewards program.  Honor offers generous equity packages that increase with position level and responsibilities, and a 401K with up to a 4% employer match.
We provide medical, dental and vision coverage including zero cost plans for employees.  Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability and Life Insurance are fully employer paid with a voluntary additional Life Insurance option.  We offer a generous time off program, mental health benefits, wellness program, and discount program.

content:
Honor exists to expand the world’s capacity to care.
We’re combining high tech with high-touch to deliver better home care for aging adults, better jobs for Care Professionals, and entirely new offerings to support the aging journey, at scale. 
Founded in 2014, and now a Series E funded “Unicorn” valued at over $1B, Honor leads the world’s largest home care network with the most advanced care platform. Our August 2021 acquisition of Home Instead has created a global company that’s revolutionizing how society cares for older adults, their families, and Care Professionals.
The Honor Care Platform combines local care and the most advanced technology to bring the highest quality care to more aging adults. 
Grow at Honor as part of a united team where everyone shows up authentically, shares ideas bravely, and solves complex problems! 
About the Work:The Cloud Infrastructure Engineer helps build out, maintain, and troubleshoot our rapidly expanding infrastructure. The Cloud Infrastructure Engineer will be part of a talented team that demonstrates superb technical competency, delivering mission critical infrastructure and ensuring the highest levels of availability, performance, and security.

Configure, deploy, and manage cloud-based resources on platforms including both AWS and Azure, ensuring high availability and security.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement scalable and reliable cloud infrastructure solutions that meet the company's business needs.
Secure identities through adoption and execution of new policies and procedures across the enterprise including, but not limited to, SSO, MFA, and auditing aberrant login attempts.
Identify and execute quarterly and yearly audits for compliance and security audits.
Optimize network performance, troubleshoot connectivity issues, and ensure minimal downtime by implementing best practices in network administration.   
Interface with Legal and adjacent teams to ensure regulatory compliance concerns are remediated and mitigated.
Implement security best practices in cloud environments.
Interface with Development, Cloud Security Engineer, Support, and associated staff to remediate identified risks to the organization.
Perform planning and complete testing for disaster recovery scenarios.
Perform planning for ransomware response.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all infrastructure and network configurations, ensuring knowledge sharing and smooth onboarding for new team members.
Architect and advise on new infrastructure and solutions to adhere to company security standards.
Maintain Cloud Administrator Certification.
Proactively audit and suggest remediations for legacy infrastructure and security configurations.
Provide and enforce infrastructure guidelines.
Audit and establish benchmarks for infrastructure configuration.
Create and maintain ticketing request procedure for all new Infrastructure.
Monitor resource utilization, identify opportunities for cost optimization, and implement scalability solutions as needed.
Ensure all non-PaaS/SaaS/IaaS infrastructure is compliant and patched.

About you:

Bachelor’s degree in a related field is preferred, not required.
Two to four years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and work experience will be considered.
Preference given to candidates with Industry Certifications.
Understand and uphold the policies and procedures established by Home Instead and the related role to the Information Technology department. 
Demonstrate discretion, integrity, and fair-mindedness consistent with company standards, practices, policies, and procedures.
Proficiency in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and a strong understanding of cloud services, including compute, storage, networking, and security.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical team members.
Ability to establish collaborative working relationships with management and colleagues.
Ability to demonstrate effective interpersonal skills essential, as well as sound judgment and good decision-making skills. 
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
Ability to maintain confidentiality of information.
Ability to plan, organize and prioritize daily, monthly, and yearly work.
Advanced knowledge of network protocols, firewall management, routing, and switching, with the ability to troubleshoot and optimize network performance.
Ability to oversee projects from beginning to end, including incorporation of new ideas and best practices and evaluation of processes and procedures to recommend improvements and changes when appropriate.
Ability to work evenings or weekends in rare cases of emergency support.

demographic_questions.description:
At Honor, one of our core values is Our Differences Propel Us - we welcome the full range of lived experiences and core identities, inclusive of everyone, and believe that our diverse experiences and opinions inspire the novel approaches we need to amplify our impact. We are also committed to our continued diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) efforts. 

We invite you to complete this optional confidential survey to help us evaluate our recruitment efforts, model diversity and equity best practices, and continue to translate our core values into action. 

Providing this information is strictly voluntary. This information will be kept secure, will not be used in the hiring process, and will be accessible to a small group to be used solely to evaluate our DEI efforts, as part of our continued commitment to an inclusive work environment.

Please reach out to us with any questions about the work and use of this information.
